2019-12-03: We regret to inform users that the archiver stack FoolFuuka&Asagi on Rbt.asia, Desuarchive, Archived.moe, and others are suffering reduced accuracy and missing posts in scraping 4chan. New, efficient, and more accurate scrapers are in the progress of development, but needs assistance and testing from C# .NET and MySQL/Percona developers to be ready for use. On behalf of all archivers, unless FoolFuuka&Asagi is replaced, we will now be unable to scrape properly under the strain of deep software inefficiency and unsustainable costs (like fireden). More details here.
Donations to our site would help to ensure a normal lifecycle replacement of drives in our RAID.
Please refrain from spamming the ghostposting system or it may not be around for long.

Quoted By: >>20034786 >>20035273 >>20035438 >>20036964 >>20037288 >>20039938
This is the longest thing i have ever completed, writing-wise.

Feels good man dot jpg

And..,

Yes. I will write me some more stuff

Writing this story was a lot of fun. I know I made some choices that annoyed people, but hey... I hope it made for a good story run.

Writing Sunset Shimmer was a trip. Because, if we stick to,strict canon, this is a mature woman who's stuck in a teenager's body on a whole nother FRIGGIN REALITY. So she has the sense of self that comes from life experience, plus (now ruined) megalomania, plus the roiling cauldron of hormones that being a teenager brings.

Put THAT person in the position of the Sunset in the writing prompt. And run with it.

Anon was inspired by a mix of the guy from Burn Notice, a sprinkling of my early life (all that moving. I did that carp 26 times,but 20 sounds more believable), and the universal everyman that is "Anonymous"... Plus that roiling cauldron of hormones etc etc

I was really hesitant to write in the mane 5. Those characters are so carved in stone that i was certain I would screw them up immediately.

I HAVE NOT SEEN EGQ. EVER.

Throwing in Fluttershy's EMT training and the limitless supply of dangerous sporting goods worked for me. I can totally see 'Shy learning how to take care of people as well as animals by her senior year. Oh, and Bruno? Bulk Biceps, baby. YEAHHHH!

Finn and Meg and Stone Pony were fun to invent.
Finn stomp-clinked into my head and set up shop. Meg took a little longer to fill out. SP was a hail mary at he last minute, but i think he worked.

Finn WILL tell some stories.

It is very likely I will write some more. It may take some time. Id like to see what happens with Sunny and Anon down the line.

Writing the sex scenes was fun.

A lot happened over the course of that week.

Now I think I really understand what the word "spent" really means.

Whee!

The 'Get 'Em!' Story
as told by Finn Saorin

>"All right... so we were out in country for a really long stupid time. They kept sending us to clear out this one set of hills. We did, We'd leave, an' those insensitive souls we had chased away would come right back an' start throwin' mortars at us again.

>"Damn inconsiderate.

>"So after we discharged about a year's worth a' ordinance at 'em, they finally got th' hint and went somewhere else, so they were some other squad's stupid problem. But that left us *there* with no one to shoot at, and that is a terrible thing to do to a motivated group of Marines.

>"With nothin' else to do, Orders came down that we should dig in and maintain a strong presence. Which was a great idea, if only th' fine officers back in th' AC had thought to send us out some rations that hadn't been sittin' in a fire zone for a month.

>"We gave up on anything with the word 'wheat' in it after we opened up a couple tins and saw that they had already been... "colonized".

>"Well I'm sorry, missy, but that's the gentlest way ah can describe what was goin' on in those tins.

>"We threw all that stuff as far away as we could, and decided we'd have to go forage for our own protein. Fortunately, the individuals we chased away from those hills hadn't thought to take their livestock with 'em.

>"Unfortunately, they also forgot to tie 'em up, or fence 'em off, or whatever you're s'posed to do with goats. So we had a number of goats amblin' about the place.

>"Also unfortunately, the CO sent word that we were not to waste ammunition in hunting the local game. That eliminated th' most direct way to acquire us some goat.

Ok. FLANKING MANEUVER (ha!) ENGAGED.
Pastebin for Hondo Flanks, PI: http://pastebin.com/y99FfKw8


My name is Hondo Flanks. I have three shots in me. Two are cider, one is tetanus. I backed into a pitchfork. I don't want to talk about it.

When I came to I was, thankfully, still in my office. My office was, unfortunately, upside down.
